page.title: 06LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: Next to the village shop is the church hall is used by the community. In the centre of the village is the church which is called Holy Trinity. Opposite the church is the local pub called the Cock Inn which is run by Mr. and Mrs. Wood the church is surrounded by small cottages and victorian houses . Along past the church is newest part of the village with fairly large modern houses,interspersed with older cottages. One of the older properties use to be a Methodist Chapel.Along thisroad we also have the graveyard and a cricket ground. Opposite the church isa road that leads to Mayfield along this you pass the Henmore Brook and also go past the old railway station.Here is the famous goal post for the Shrovetide Football game played on Shrove Tuesay yearly.
